**Course Objectives**

The course is designed to help students develop their English skills. The aim of this course is thus multifold: to enhance students’ English reading comprehension, to increase their vocabulary by looking at how a given word is used in multiple contexts, and to improve their critical thinking skills through thought-provoking texts. Thus, the assigned readings cover a wide variety of topics in literature and culture: K-pop music, cancel culture, Harry Potter, detective fiction, etc.. In this semester, students are expected to attend classes regularly, to hand in homework punctually, and to participate actively in class discussion. Any copy-and-paste content is prohibited in homework and group presentation.

**Course Requirements and Grading**

1.  Attendance and class participation (25%)  
    In this semester, students have to attend classes regularly and to prepare for class discussion guided through the assigned texts. The course simultaneously encourages them to respond critically to questions raised by the texts. The attendance policy allows them to take a leave **TWICE** without penalty only in a situation where they send a formal absence e-mail to me. HOWEVER, absence from **THREE** classes will affect your grade on this part (raw score\* 0.8). **Students absent from FOUR classes will fail the course.** Late arrival (arriving 15 minutes late to class) counts as absence. **Please note that students are required to turn their cameras on in online meetings.**
2.  Vocabulary or Reading Quizzes (25%)  
    Details will be further announced and discussed in the first meeting.
    
3.  Oral Exam (Midterm) (25%)  
    **The oral exam is tentatively scheduled for 12 Sep 2021 (W8) and 19 Sep 2021 (W9).** The selected topics for the exam will be announced a week prior to the exam date. In the exam, these topics will be randomly assigned to students, and each student will have a 5-minute conversation with the instructor.
    
4.  Final Exam (25%)  
    **The final exam is tentatively scheduled for 7 Jan 2022 (W16).** It consists of true/false, multiple choice, matching item, id questions, and essay questions. Details will be further announced and discussed in the first meeting.
